metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2015 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ext4_orphan_del function in fs/ext4/namei.c in the Linux kernel before3.7.3 does not properly handle orphan-list entries for non-journalfilesystems, which allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denialof service (system hang) via a crafted filesystem on removable media, asdemonstrated by the e2fsprogs tests/f_orphan_extents_inode/image.gz test.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required
